185732288.review:
Итак, впечатления очень двоякие. С одной стороны, я был очарован этой игрой и заранее нарек Хидео Камию гением. 
Потому что он подарил мне буквально лучший слешер из тех, что я играл. И даже объяснить причину его великолепия не представляется возможным. Оказалось просто круто жать на все кнопки подряд, выбивая комбо. Плюс ко всему совершенно чудесная заглавная героиня. Лучший слешер, иначе и не скажешь. 
Но!
И это ооооочень важное «но»!
Всё великолепие игры рассыпается в прах ровно в тот момент, когда разработчики решают в 15 главе, что абсолютно безжалостно заебать игрока - отличная идея. 
Поймите правильно, череда неубиваемых боссов просто не заканчивается и утомляет даже с читом на неуязвимость. Я не знаю кто те люди, которые проходят последние три главы по чесноку, но дай им Бог здоровья.
Резюмируя, нельзя не признать, что японцы из Платинум умеют в стиль, замечательных персонажей и уникальные боевые системы. Но им критически, до зубовного скрежета, не хватает умения вовремя остановиться. Что это, если не антагонизм человеческой души?

P.S. Они даже в процессе завершающих титров поставили ваншотящего босса. Это так плохо, что даже смешно.

[h1][b]Bayonetta[/b][/h1]

[b]Rating: 7/10 - Good[/b]

[b]Bayonetta[/b] has a [b]Great[/b] and smooth combat system with a high skill ceiling, combined with a ridiculously fun story, some [b]Great[/b] art direction and [b]Good[/b] set pieces. 185500209.review:
ACT经典之作-猎天使魔女。
这个游戏有最漂亮的主角。
剧情类似鬼泣4，挺*哥特*的，看个乐子。但是没什么好说的，这种游戏剧情都不重要。
老丁头是见一个打一个，管你什么恶魔还是天使还是教皇，贝姐打的就是天使。
关卡丰富度远比鬼泣4多得多，但是也不见得是个好事，毕竟就是冲着动作连段来的，你给我玩打飞机，玩暴力摩托，使得动作出场率不高。
画面复杂时，会掉帧，但是屏幕晃动的比较厉害，所以不仔细看还是能接受的。
游戏后期画面挺美的。截了不少图，但是截图有几率不好使，有几率会让游戏崩溃。
QTE挺折磨人的，也挺多的，有些特殊关卡也比较折磨，毕竟是老游戏，可以接受。
然而连段手感一般，颇有种飞不起来的感觉，
游戏时主动连段的机会不多，打的精英怪几乎都有霸体，boss都是大个儿，都是长地里的，根本不能击飞，互动性不多，从这点来看和dmc鬼泣更相似。
画面挺乱的，大个boss+蝴蝶夫人就能让整个屏幕乱作一团，除非你自己开修改器锁小怪的血，否则没机会练习连段。
总之，瑕不掩瑜，7/10
希望4代能上pc，别逼我跪下来求你，老光头。

185476101.review:
At its core, the game delivers a highly polished combat system. The variety of combos, weapons, and mechanics like "Witch Time" rewards players who master its intricacies. The responsiveness and fluidity of the gameplay are top-notch, with battles that often feel like elaborate dance routines.

However, the sheer complexity of the controls and the overwhelming number of mechanics may alienate newcomers or casual players. The game doesn’t do a great job of teaching its systems, and button-mashing can sometimes yield success, which dilutes the reward for skillful play. Some boss fights, while spectacular in scale, can feel visually overwhelming, making it difficult to follow the action.

The Gothic-meets-futuristic world of Vigrid, the intricate designs of angels and demons, and the titular character herself are all memorable. However, the game’s commitment to excess is worth noting. Cutscenes often drag with their overindulgence in slow-motion flair and exaggerated action, making it feel like style takes precedence over substance. That said, this over-the-top approach is what characterizes the game and makes it so recognizable.

While impressive for its time, Bayonetta’s visuals haven’t aged perfectly, particularly in terms of environmental detail. The contrast between the elaborate character designs and the often-bland backdrops is noticeable, occasionally pulling you out of the otherwise immersive experience.

The story is undeniably its weakest point—and most players don’t come to the game for the plot. While the game leans heavily into camp and absurdity, its narrative—a mix of witches, ancient lore, and lost memories—is a confusing jumble of half-baked ideas. It feels like an afterthought, serving primarily as a vehicle to justify moving from one spectacular fight to the next.

Bayonetta herself is a strong protagonist with charisma to spare, but even her confident, self-aware persona can’t completely save the storytelling. Some of her over-the-top moments, while fun, border on cringeworthy and may not resonate with all players.

Overall, despite its downsides, the game is definitely worth playing for hack-and-slash fans. However, certain sections—like turret sequences or vehicle levels—felt more frustrating than fun and disrupted the otherwise smooth flow.

On the bright side, the game offers decent replay value for those who enjoy chasing high scores or experimenting with new weapons, though this feature will likely only appeal to completionists.

185327221.review:
As a DMC fan who never played Bayonetta, here's my review.

Gameplay: This is much better than DMC Why ? Because while DMC combat consists of guns, swords and dodge; Bayonetta's moves consists of punches, kicks, guns and dodge. Which adds for more flexibility and creativity in combos. Also. a perfect dodge in Bayonetta slows down time, giving the player more incentive to dodge.

Story: Its meh. Nothing much to say

Characters: Bayonetta is a female Dante. I consider DMC 3 Dante to be peak Dante in terms of funny and being a badass. And Bayonetta > DMC 3 Dante. Already fell in love with her. Feminine badassery at its best.

Enemies: Really not much to say. Compared to DMC, it's ok.

Music: Its perfect. Fly me to the Moon was enough to get me hooked. 

Overall: I would give this a 9.8/ 10. This game is much better than DMC 3 And 5. And I'm a hardcore DMC fan. I can't believe I ignored this game for too long.  I really wish we had the sequels on Steam.

185294828.review:
***REVIEW OF THE PC PORT, NOT THE GAME ITSELF***

Please dont play this on PC. If you do, don't let it sit in your library and play it soon so you can  check if your game has bugs. I only played the vestibule chapter, which is roughly the first hour of the game, and even within that I had several bugs including one game breaking one. 

spoilers for the vestibule chapter cutscenes below

--- During several cutscenes, many of the in-game models were invisible, to the point where I actually couldn't tell what was going on at some points until I watched the cutscene on youtube and saw what was *actually* happening. For me, all of these cutscenes were bugged:
     - When Bayonetta and Enzo were in the car, the plane crashing did not reflect in the rear-view mirror (the mirror was just flat gray) so I had no idea what Enzo was expressing concern about until the plane crash happened in the following scene
     - When Bayonetta and Jeanne were having their stand-off, their guns were completely missing / invisible so they were shooting things / pointing at each other with finger guns
          - *I did this chapter three times after troubleshooting each time, and the first time I did it, Bayonetta's gun models were invisible even before this cutscene during actual combat
     - The bus that drives / crashes between Bayonetta and Jeanne (which gives Jeanne some cover to flee) was invisible
     - Enzo's car, which Bayonetta grabs from the air and throw on the road, was completely invisible
--- Besides things being invisible, some parts of the cutscenes just did not happen
     - The first time I played through the prologue chapter, Bayonetta's flashback she has while in Enzo's car did not play
--- While trying to play this chapter a second time, I skipped the earlier cutscenes to try to get to the last one (where Bayonetta and Jeanne are having a stand off) because that was where I was having the most bugs and I wanted to check if they were fixed or not. However, when I skipped the cutscene where Bayonetta and Enzo are talking then see the plane crash, instead of taking me right to combat, the game showed me a static image of the road / bridge that the cutscene I skipped took place on. Bayonetta fell off screen, and I couldnt see nor move her. Nothing I pressed on the controller let me move past that screen to start combat. I could still open the pause menu, however, but I couldn't do much there because the only option on that menu was pretty much to return to the game (which was still a static screen of the road). After waiting a few minutes for the combat area to load in, nothing was happening, so I just had to restart the entire game.

I've verified the files at least 7-8 times. I uninstalled and reinstalled the game. I changed the resolution. I stopped using bluetooth devices (like my speaker) in case that was causing issues. I dont have a single mod for this downloaded so nothing could be interfering in that regard. I even uninstalled my antivirus because it was taking up so much ram and ive seen people say that uninstalling it made their computer run so much faster. None of these solutions did anything, and the problem might actually be worse now as ive been getting the un-progressable static image screen more often. I've been looking online for ways to fix this but I've only come across a handful of other people that have these same issues, and I haven't found a surefire way to fix it. I've look at many forums and guides for other common bugs which people seem to have with this port (such as the smaller screen duplicate popping up during cutscenes or the insane framerate drop), and I luckily don't have these, but as I said these are different issues from mine so I still don't know how to fix this game. I think it's a lost cause at this point :(

Regardless of whether it's the invisible model bugs I was having, the framerate drop, or other crashes, this port seems to have a lot of issues that really take away from the enjoyment and even playability of this game. I was excited to play Bayonetta and I'm really disappointed I can't for now knowing that my cutscenes will be confusing because of invisible models and I may have random crashes at some point that necessitate restarting the game entirely. This is clearly meant to be played on something else, like a Switch or Xbox.

185215049.review: Quitando el esfuerzo por parte de los creadores de echarle carretadas de polígonos a Bayonetta para que esté buenorra (de sobresaliente), el juego está muy bien. Es entretenido, variado, con un argumento que es una locura en el más puro estilo japonés. Incluso aunque abusa sin vergüenza de las secuencias de botoncitos, como su ejecución habitualmente te lleva a escenas de puro placer visual, se pueden perdonar un poco. Es un juego de excesos en todos los sentidos, tanto que no he podido evitar soltar alguna carcajada en algunos puntos culminantes o de Climax, por las insanas barbaridades que se les ocurren a estos señores de Platinum. En definitiva, muy bueno, muy intenso, muy entretenido. Mención especial a la tremenda fusilada de la banda sonora de Batman Begins en una de las secuencias culminantes del juego, que la verdad es que queda muy chula. Os adoro, Platinum.

184956074.review:
It is alright.

I think the game is good, but lacks focus. There is a clear emphasis on style over substance, which is strange, because the actual substance of the game is extremely fun. You just don't get to enjoy it uninterrupted. There is a constant barrage of different gameplay types thrown at you. Vehicle levels, QTEs, platforming, etc. The main character action gameplay is extremely solid, and I feel it has extreme potential for combos and satisfying gameplay, but it simply does not let you focus in on that for too long.

I found the first few levels to be simply overwhelming with the amount of new stuff thrown at you. The main moveset is pretty much complete right away, save for a few moves you can buy. So as I was trying to get a grasp of how to use it, I was constantly hit with new enemies and gameplay mechanics. I thought it was too much all at once. The main weapons you will use are thrown at you within the first few levels, and that too I found overwhelming. It was too much all at once. For future playthroughs, getting everything so quick will be great, but for the first one it is not paced properly. 

The core gameplay is great once you take time to get to know it. I personally just stuck with the sword and ignored the other movesets because it was too much. It is the usual platinum games affair, but with much more speed and timing involved.

I did not engage with the story, since I just wanted to focus on the gameplay, but from what I saw, it seemed interested, albiet a bit confusing. Though, that is likely due to me not reading the lore pages you find.

Overall, the game is great when it lets you play it. It is bogged down by constant QTEs, Gameplay mix ups, and platforming. When you are just thrown in an arena with enemies though, it is a great time. 7/10

184825673.review: Oyun acayip tatlı bir hack n slash oyunu. Türe yabancı arkadaşlar için; genelde tepeden yada ona yakın bir kamera açısına sahip olduğumuz, biz 1 kişi iken üzerimize akın akın gelen düşmanları havalı kombolarla (ve kombo sayacıyla) alt ettiğimiz, bossları genel olarak aşırı epik hissettiren bir oyun türüdür. Örnek olarak eski God of Warları ve Darksiders ı verebilirim. Eğer evli barklı bir adamsanız bu oyun sizin için pek uygun olmayabilir. Oyunda bol bol çıplaklık bulunuyor. (Aşırı cinsellik bulunuyor.) Benim öyle bir derdim olmadığı için zevkle oyndım :D. Oyunun hikayesi hakkında çok fazla spoiler olmasın diye pek birşey söylemiyorum ama oyun absürt bir şekilde hikayeyi ele almayı tercih etmiş. Oyunun başlarında bu yapısını pek sevmemiştim ama sonlara doğru alıştım hatta bayıldım. Oyunu temel olarak 10 saat gibi bir sürede bitirebiliyorsunuz. İpucu olarak ta kargaya dönüşme yeteneği açıldığı gibi alın. Dövüşlerde olmasa bile oyunun geri kalanında işinizi çok kolaylaştırıyor.

184703996.review:
Once again one of the games I like in principle but when try it out it just doesn't click. Good port, settings work fine, understandable controls and it even runs fairly well. I like its execution of combo moves and emphasis on combo-based free-flow combat. This is why this one actually gets recommended. It is a fairly good hack-n-slasher or whatever is closest genre.

Two drawbacks are mostly from level design side of things. Most of them almost mandatorily will have quiet portion and at least several enemy encounters in obviously arena-like setting, gets old a bit quickly. Boss fight setups follow much of the same principles (didn't test them all naturally as haven't even finished the game properly), just add sequenced moves and damage checks (you need to take off some hp to progress).

At least we got it released on PC which is quite good on its own.

184596617.review:
Eu simplesmente amo Devil May Cry, eu joguei e platinei na psn o dmc 5 e o dmc 3, comprei esse jogo achando que é um devil may cry, e de fato, o jogo foi feito pelo mesmo criador da franquia, porem eu sinto que há coisas nesse jogo que deixam a desejar, eu simplesmente nao gostei de algumas mecanicas no combate, eu acho que os inimigos desse jogo atacam demais, nao deixando o jogador fazer combo, parece que os inimigos não sentem os golpes do jogador, alem de que, na metade final do jogo eu queria que acabasse, pois alguns combates nao sao nada divertidos, alem da repetição de bosses como inimigo (uma parada que eu simplesmente acho um saco, boss que virou inimigo padrão)

Escrevendo assim parece que eu odeio o jogo, na verdade eu gostei ate pq eu gosto de hack and slash, gostei da trilha sonora, jogabilidade, história e a propria protagonista é carismática demais, porem eu sinto que esse jogo é um jogo nota 7.5, é um jogo bom, porem tem coisas que me desagrada, principalmente alguns combates que chegam a ser repetitivos e muito frustrante! ainda mais aqueles dois inimigos chatos pra caralho que nao deixa o fudido do jogador atacar pq contra atacam enquanto o jogador está atacando! puta merda o quanto eu fiquei frustrado com esses dois inimigos em específicos. 

Em geral, é um jogo bom, desafiador até, porem as vezes injusto, senti q eles poderiam melhorar o combate, tem versos que sao muito frustrantes, alem da mira invertida em algumas partes em específicas que deixam a desejar.

184277627.review:
[h1]Bayonetta - Avaliação Sem Spoilers[/h1]
[h2]Nota Geral: 8/10[/h2]

[b]Bayonetta[/b] é um Hack N' Slash de ação da Platinum Games que, até onde eu entendi, conta uma história com bruxas e tem uma temática divina (envolvendo deuses, anjos, etc).

[b]É um jogão.[/b] Sinceramente, acho que é essencial jogar isso se você é fã de Hack N' Slashs. Mesmo sendo um jogo de 2009, ele traz uma ação muito boa, e as lutas são bem frenéticas. A mecânica de [i]Witch Time[/i] (poder principal da personagem) é bem interessante e contribui muito para a ação do jogo. Passei um pouco de raiva jogando, porque cheguei a uns 80% do jogo sem saber que dava para trocar de arma. Então, aqui vai uma dica: [u]não saia pulando todas as cutscenes ou diálogos.[/u]

O jogo tem uma dificuldade legal. Eu achei difícil enquanto jogava, mas isso foi mais por conta do motivo que comentei no parágrafo anterior. Os gráficos são bonitos, e a jogabilidade é bem divertida. As cenas da personagem sensualizando e tirando a roupa para usar habilidades são facilmente esquecíveis — você nem percebe, mas é bom evitar jogar próximo de alguém da sua família.

[hr][/hr]

[h2]Contras[/h2]
Vi outras análises aqui, e não fui só eu que pensei isso:

[b]Poluição visual:[/b] Tem momentos em que eu simplesmente não sei em quem estou batendo ou onde estou. Realmente espero que isso não seja falta das minhas habilidades gamers. Os inimigos, na maior parte das vezes, têm cores parecidas com o cenário, o que contribui para a confusão.
[b]Falta de avisos nos ataques inimigos:[/b] Sinto falta de um aviso quando os inimigos vão atacar, como acontece em [i]Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance[/i], onde aparece um leve flash vermelho na tela antes de alguns ataques. Muitas vezes, quando tomo dano, é porque não percebi que o inimigo ia me atacar.
[b]Checkpoints atrasados:[/b] Checkpoints ficam um pouco atrás de onde deveriam. Acho que é normal jogadores de Hack N' Slash acharem chato ter que refazer tudo ou andar até o mesmo lugar toda vez que morrem. A gente só quer sair matando os inimigos, sem a chatice de refazer o caminho ou passar tudo de novo.
[b]Falta de tradução:[/b] Isso, para mim, não foi um problema tão grande, mas sei que pode ser para algumas pessoas. O jogo não tem suporte em português. Porém, isso pode ser resolvido facilmente baixando uma tradução PT-BR (que é fácil de encontrar).
[hr][/hr]

[h2]Conclusão[/h2]
Bayonetta é uma experiência incrível para fãs do gênero, oferecendo a ação que um player deseja, mecânicas únicas e um visual estiloso que, mesmo com algumas falhas, ainda brilha. A poluição visual e a ausência de avisos durante os ataques inimigos podem até irritar, mas não chegam a tirar a diversão do jogo. É um grande título, mas com espaço para melhorias em alguns aspectos. No geral, vale muito a pena jogar, e por isso, levo em conta tanto os pontos altos quanto os baixos para dar uma nota [b]8/10[/b].

184191096.review:
"Bayonetta: la reina de la sensualidad y el caos"

Bayonetta no es solo un personaje de videojuego; es una fuerza de la naturaleza que combina elegancia, descaro y un toque de picardía que te deja sin aliento. Cada vez que aparece en pantalla, es imposible no quedar hipnotizado. Su caminar es un desfile, sus movimientos son poesía en combate, y su actitud... bueno, digamos que Bayonetta sabe perfectamente lo irresistible que es.

Cada ataque que lanza está cargado de estilo y sensualidad. ¿Un uppercut? Lo hace con más gracia que un bailarín de ballet. ¿Una pose después de un combo? Como si estuviera frente a las cámaras de una revista de moda. Incluso cuando invoca demonios gigantes para aplastar a sus enemigos, lo hace con una sonrisa que dice: "Sí, soy increíble, ¿y qué?"

Y luego está su traje: una obra maestra hecha de su propio cabello, que desaparece estratégicamente en los momentos más intensos. Es imposible no maravillarse con cómo combina poder y seducción en cada detalle. Bayonetta no necesita pedir permiso para ser audaz; simplemente lo es.

¿Los combates? Son pura adrenalina. Pero admitámoslo: la verdadera razón por la que seguís jugando es para verla brillar. Bayonetta transforma cada pelea en un espectáculo digno de ovación, y lo hace mientras te lanza una mirada que parece decir: "Sabés que estás disfrutando esto tanto como yo".

En resumen, Bayonetta es el epítome de lo sexy y lo badass. Si alguna vez quisiste un juego donde la protagonista no solo domine la acción, sino también tu atención, este es el indicado. Así que preparate, porque una vez que entres en su mundo, no vas a querer salir.

183852760.review:
Before I begin, I played this on its normal difficulty.

This game is somewhat enjoyable, but there are a lot of factors that can make it feel very infuriating and exhausting. It all depends on what kind of player you are and whether you’re ready to invest some time to understand what’s going on.

To start, the game really doesn’t like it if you’re playing casually or for fun. If you take damage during a fight (or a verse), your score is penalized. Using healing or power-up items and dying also plays in to the score that you are given at the end of a chapter, which determines which award you receive. I have been given countless of stone awards because of these factors. Not that I minded after a while of playing, but it definitely gets annoying to see especially after trying really hard to get a good score in a certain chapter. Also, certain enemy types (such as Grace and Glory or Joy) can be seriously difficult to beat without certain weapons or techniques which could almost force you to die/take damage/heal. Some of the combos that you’ve learned while progressing could just become absolutely useless during a fight because they’re either too quick, don’t get staggered, or you’re overwhelmed by three of the same enemy type (like certain Joy fights which have led to unbelievably frustrating deaths). Be ready to fail, especially if it’s your first time playing.

Secondly, there’s a pretty sharp learning curve that builds up throughout the game despite it seeming awfully straight-forward at first. The game takes pride in its hack-and-slash mechanics, so you’ll have to learn a combination of moves and abilities to progress through fights. Button-mashing becomes useless after the first three or four chapters because it assumes you’ve already got the hang of it and know what you’re doing. As I’ve mentioned before, some fights can make some moves or abilities absolutely useless (like Wicked Weave or Witch Time combos against Gracious and Glorious because they’re not affected by them or don’t stagger in time for you to avoid taking damage). Personally I scumbagged my way through certain bosses because a single combo worked. I’m not proud of it, but you gotta do what you gotta do. Also do note that this game and many of its fans encourages you to replay it many times because “it’s more fun after you understand what’s going on”. That’s completely fine if you get invested in the story, but for a casual player, this just feels disappointing.

Also, don’t expect to understand the story when you begin. The game throws you right into the action with an awfully confusing introduction as you’re supposed to listen to the narrator talk while you’re fighting for your life on floating rocks and stuff. It’s like patting your head and rubbing your stomach at the same time while also running away from a group of serial murderers. The story slowly builds on itself and makes more sense as you progress through the chapters and helps you understand why you even exist and what you’re fighting all these enemies for.

While I’m leaving a not recommended review, I always recommend that you use Steam’s two hour policy to your advantage and try it out for yourself. I think that’s plenty of time to make your own decision whether to continue playing or to look somewhere else. I would also recommend watching videos about the game and its later-chapter boss fights. Personally, because I don’t have great experience with fighting games, it took me longer to form my opinion.

183645228.review:
There was a lot of the story i did not understand, but it was alright. The fighting is great, and the animations for the "torture" it fantastic. 
There are a lot of small bosses and big bosses, and i  had some problems with them considering the key mapping, because it feels like a switch-game in many ways. There are some quick time reactions that feels weird, but might make sense with a switch,  and the camera wants to move by itself a lot of the times. I had to spend some time in the settings in the beginning to put up the sensitivity and invert all of the camera settings.
Kinda makes me want a switch to play the other games.
